speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: SCENE I. A field near Frogmore.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS and SIMPLE

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I pray you now, good master Slender's serving-man,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: and friend Simple by your name, which way have you

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: looked for Master Caius, that calls himself doctor of physic?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Marry, sir, the pittie-ward, the park-ward, every

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: way; old Windsor way, and every way but the town

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: way.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I most fehemently desire you you will also look that

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: way.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: I will, sir.

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Pless my soul, how full of chollors I am, and

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: trempling of mind! I shall be glad if he have

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: deceived me. How melancholies I am! I will knog

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: his urinals about his knave's costard when I have

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: good opportunities for the ork. 'Pless my soul!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sings

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To shallow rivers, to whose falls

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Melodious birds sings madrigals;

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: There will we make our peds of roses,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And a thousand fragrant posies.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To shallow--

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Mercy on me! I have a great dispositions to cry.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sings

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Melodious birds sing madrigals--

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: When as I sat in Pabylon--

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And a thousand vagram posies.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To shallow  and c.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Re-enter SIMPLE

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Yonder he is coming, this way, Sir Hugh.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: He's welcome.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sings

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To shallow rivers, to whose falls-

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Heaven prosper the right! What weapons is he?

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: No weapons, sir. There comes my master, Master

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: Shallow, and another gentleman, from Frogmore, over

speaker: SIMPLE
text_entry: the stile, this way.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Pray you, give me my gown; or else keep it in your arms.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Enter PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: How now, master Parson! Good morrow, good Sir Hugh.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Keep a gamester from the dice, and a good student

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: from his book, and it is wonderful.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: [Aside]  Ah, sweet Anne Page!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: 'Save you, good Sir Hugh!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: 'Pless you from his mercy sake, all of you!

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: What, the sword and the word! do you study them

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: both, master parson?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And youthful still! in your doublet and hose this

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: raw rheumatic day!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: There is reasons and causes for it.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: We are come to you to do a good office, master parson.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Fery well: what is it?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Yonder is a most reverend gentleman, who, belike

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: having received wrong by some person, is at most

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: odds with his own gravity and patience that ever you

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: saw.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: I have lived fourscore years and upward; I never

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: heard a man of his place, gravity and learning, so

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: wide of his own respect.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: What is he?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I think you know him; Master Doctor Caius, the

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: renowned French physician.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Got's will, and his passion of my heart! I had as

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: lief you would tell me of a mess of porridge.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Why?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: He has no more knowledge in Hibocrates and Galen,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: --and he is a knave besides; a cowardly knave as you

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: would desires to be acquainted withal.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: I warrant you, he's the man should fight with him.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: [Aside]  O sweet Anne Page!

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: It appears so by his weapons. Keep them asunder:

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: here comes Doctor Caius.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Enter Host, DOCTOR CAIUS, and RUGBY

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Nay, good master parson, keep in your weapon.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: So do you, good master doctor.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Disarm them, and let them question: let them keep

speaker: Host
text_entry: their limbs whole and hack our English.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: I pray you, let-a me speak a word with your ear.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vherefore vill you not meet-a me?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: [Aside to DOCTOR CAIUS]  Pray you, use your patience:

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: in good time.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, you are de coward, de Jack dog, John ape.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: [Aside to DOCTOR CAIUS]  Pray you let us not be

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: laughing-stocks to other men's humours; I desire you

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: in friendship, and I will one way or other make you amends.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Aloud

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: I will knog your urinals about your knave's cockscomb

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: for missing your meetings and appointments.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Diable! Jack Rugby,--mine host de Jarteer,--have I

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: not stay for him to kill him? have I not, at de place

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: I did appoint?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: As I am a Christians soul now, look you, this is the

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: place appointed: I'll be judgement by mine host of

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: the Garter.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Peace, I say, Gallia and Gaul, French and Welsh,

speaker: Host
text_entry: soul-curer and body-curer!

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Ay, dat is very good; excellent.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Peace, I say! hear mine host of the Garter. Am I

speaker: Host
text_entry: politic? am I subtle? am I a Machiavel? Shall I

speaker: Host
text_entry: lose my doctor? no; he gives me the potions and the

speaker: Host
text_entry: motions. Shall I lose my parson, my priest, my Sir

speaker: Host
text_entry: Hugh? no; he gives me the proverbs and the

speaker: Host
text_entry: no-verbs. Give me thy hand, terrestrial; so. Give me

speaker: Host
text_entry: thy hand, celestial; so. Boys of art, I have

speaker: Host
text_entry: deceived you both; I have directed you to wrong

speaker: Host
text_entry: places: your hearts are mighty, your skins are

speaker: Host
text_entry: whole, and let burnt sack be the issue. Come, lay

speaker: Host
text_entry: their swords to pawn. Follow me, lads of peace;

speaker: Host
text_entry: follow, follow, follow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text_entry: Trust me, a mad host. Follow, gentlemen, follow.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: [Aside]  O sweet Anne Page!

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Exeunt SHALLOW, SLENDER, PAGE, and Host

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Ha, do I perceive dat? have you make-a de sot of

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: us, ha, ha?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: This is well; he has made us his vlouting-stog. I

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: desire you that we may be friends; and let us knog

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: our prains together to be revenge on this same

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: scall, scurvy cogging companion, the host of the Garter.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: By gar, with all my heart. He promise to bring me

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: where is Anne Page; by gar, he deceive me too.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Well, I will smite his noddles. Pray you, follow.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Exeunt
